src.features package¶

Submodules¶

src.features.build_features module¶

build_features.py¶

This package contains function to build features before doing machine learning on it

src.features.build_features.dropna(df, num_features, cat_features)[source]¶

replace the NaN of the numerical features by the mean of this specific features, and drop the NaN for the categorical features

Parameters

  • df (DataFrame) – dataframe, application_train/test

  • num_features (List) – list of the name of numerical features in the dataset

  • cat_features (List) – list of the name of categorical features in the dataset

Returns

DataFrame without NaN values

src.features.build_features.feature_selection(df)[source]¶

selection of feature, intersection of 6 ways of feature selection https://www.kaggle.com/sz8416/6-ways-for-feature-selection

Parameters

df (DataFrame) – datafarme to select features from

Returns

DataFrame with relevant features

src.features.build_features.get_features(app_train)[source]¶

return 2 list of the name of categorical and numerical features of the dataset

Parameters

app_train (DataFrame) – dataframe containing training data

Returns

Two lists of categorical and numerical features of the dataset

src.features.build_features.main()[source]¶

retrieve the raw dataset and process it(feature selection and handle Nan), processed dataset can be find at data/processed

src.features.build_features.preprocessor_create(num_features, cat_features)[source]¶

return a preprocessor that is useful to onehotencode the object features of the dataset

Parameters

  • num_features (List) – list of the name of numerical features in the dataset

  • cat_features (List) – list of the name of categorical features in the dataset

Returns

ColumnTransformer used for the onehotencoding of the categorical features
